required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Association of Cytokines With the Development of Complications in Burn and Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis (TENS) Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Association of Cytokines With the Development of Complications in Burn and Toxic Epidermal Necrolysis (TENS) Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Joseph M. Still Research Foundation, Inc.

clinical_study.source: Joseph M. Still Research Foundation, Inc.

brief_summary.textblock: This study will involve blood draws to test for specific cytokines. The study goal is to gain a better understanding of the role of inflammatory response in the development of specific complications in burn and TENS patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Cytokine Response that develops into complications
primary_outcome.description: The number of burn and TENS patients that develop subsequent medical complications

arm_group.description: This study will involve blood draws to test for specific cytokines

intervention.description: This study will involve blood draws to test for specific cytokines

study_pop.textblock: Samples size will be patients from the burn ICU.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- is â‰¥18 years of age
- has been admitted to the Joseph M. Still Burn Center at Doctors Hospital Augusta with a burn diagnosis, or TENS OR SJS diagnosis (confirmed or non-confirmed), with an expected length of stay to be at least 7 days
- the subject or their legally authorized representative is able to provide informed consent
- has a negative urine or serum pregnancy test at screening (if female and has potential for pregnancy)
Exclusion Criteria:
- is moribund, or in the opinion of the investigator is not expected to survive
- has sustained an electrical burn

overall_official.affiliation: Joseph M. Still Research Foundation, Inc.

facility.name: Joseph M. Still Burn Center at Doctors Hospital

patient_data.ipd_description: Study results will be analyzed, and study data presented at an appropriate related Congress meeting. Journal publication in a related peer-reviewed journal would be expected after presentation.
